inclusion.criterion: age greater than or equal to 50 years old
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: life expectancy greater than or equal to 10 years, according to the clinical judgement of study investigators
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: no mention of previous prostate biopsy

exclusion.criterion: PSA level measurement within 3 years of recruitment date
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: abnormal digital rectal examination of the prostate consistent with prostate cancer
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: no mention of abnormal digital rectal examination

exclusion.criterion: history of prostate cancer in one or more first-degree relatives diagnosed at less than 50 years of age
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: lower urinary tract voiding symptoms (IPSS greater than or equal to 8)
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: no mention of lower urinary tract voiding symptoms

exclusion.criterion: prior or current use of 5-alpha reductase inhibitor medications (finasteride or dutasteride)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: patient unable to communicate in English in order to give proper informed consent
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: no mention of patient unable to communicate in English

exclusion.criterion: claustrophobia or other medical indication which would preclude MRI
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: any medical condition which, in the opinion of the investigator, might interfere with the evaluation of the study objectives
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient is a 63-year-old man presenting to the Emergency Department with acute urinary retention. He has a large prostate and bladder filled with urine.
